presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: The presence penalty Aof the completion.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: The frequency penalty of the completion.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: The stop tokens of the completion.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Set the timeout for each request to the LLM. If you are running a local LLM that takes a while to respond, you might want to set this to avoid timeouts.

verify_ssl.title: Verify Ssl
verify_ssl.description: Whether to verify SSL certificates for requests.

ca_bundle_path.title: Ca Bundle Path
ca_bundle_path.description: Path to a custom CA bundle to use when making the HTTP request

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Proxy URL to use when making the HTTP request

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Headers to use when making the HTTP request

title.title: Title
title.description: The title you wish to give your model.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the model. This is used to determine the type of model, and how to interact with it.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model. Used to autodetect prompt template.

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: OpenAI, Anthropic, Together, or other API key

api_base.title: Api Base
api_base.description: The base URL of the LLM API.

context_length.title: Context Length
context_length.description: The maximum context length of the LLM in tokens, as counted by count_tokens.

template.title: Template
template.description: The chat template used to format messages. This is auto-detected for most models, but can be overridden here.

completion_options.title: Completion Options
completion_options.description: Options for the completion endpoint. Read more about the completion options in the documentation.

system_message.title: System Message
system_message.description: A system message that will always be followed by the LLM

request_options.title: Request Options
request_options.description: Options for the HTTP request to the LLM.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default model. If other model roles are not set, they will fall back to default.

chat.title: Chat
chat.description: The model to use for chat. If not set, will fall back to default.

edit.title: Edit
edit.description: The model to use for editing. If not set, will fall back to default.

summarize.title: Summarize
summarize.description: The model to use for summarization. If not set, will fall back to default.

n_retrieve.title: N Retrieve
n_retrieve.description: Number of results to initially retrieve from vector database

n_final.title: N Final
n_final.description: Final number of results to use after re-ranking

use_reranking.title: Use Reranking
use_reranking.description: Whether to use re-ranking, which will allow initial selection of n_retrieve results, then will use an LLM to select the top n_final results

rerank_group_size.title: Rerank Group Size
rerank_group_size.description: Number of results to group together when re-ranking. Each group will be processed in parallel.

ignore_files.title: Ignore Files
ignore_files.description: Files to ignore when indexing the codebase. You can use glob patterns, such as **/*.py. This is useful for directories that contain generated code, or other directories that are not relevant to the codebase.

disallowed_steps.title: Disallowed Steps
disallowed_steps.description: Steps that are not allowed to be run, and will be skipped if attempted

allow_anonymous_telemetry.title: Allow Anonymous Telemetry
allow_anonymous_telemetry.description: If this field is set to True, we will collect anonymous telemetry as described in the documentation page on telemetry. If set to False, we will not collect any data.

model_roles.title: Model Roles
model_roles.description: Roles for models. Each entry should be the title of a model in the models array.

system_message.title: System Message
system_message.description: A system message that will always be followed by the LLM

completion_options.title: Completion Options
completion_options.description: Default options for completion. These will be overriden by any options set for a specific model.

slash_commands.title: Slash Commands
slash_commands.description: An array of slash commands that let you map custom Steps to a shortcut.

custom_commands.title: Custom Commands
custom_commands.description: An array of custom commands that allow you to reuse prompts. Each has name, description, and prompt properties. When you enter /<name> in the text input, it will act as a shortcut to the prompt.

default.name: test
default.prompt:
{{{ input }}}

Write a comprehensive set of unit tests for the selected code. It should setup, run tests that check for correctness including important edge cases, and teardown. Ensure that the tests are complete and sophisticated. Give the tests just as chat output, don't edit any file.
default.description: This is an example custom command. Use /config to edit it and create more

context_providers.title: Context Providers
context_providers.description: A list of ContextProvider objects that can be used to provide context to the LLM by typing '@'. Read more about ContextProviders in the documentation.

user_token.title: User Token
user_token.description: An optional token to identify the user.

data_server_url.title: Data Server Url
data_server_url.description: The URL of the server where development data is sent. No data is sent unless you have explicitly set the `user_token` property to a valid token that we have shared.

disable_summaries.title: Disable Summaries
disable_summaries.description: If set to `True`, Continue will not generate summaries for each Step. This can be useful if you want to save on compute.

disable_indexing.title: Disable Indexing
disable_indexing.description: If set to `True`, Continue will not index the codebase. This is mainly used for debugging purposes.

retrieval_settings.title: Retrieval Settings
retrieval_settings.description: Settings for the retrieval system. Read more about the retrieval system in the documentation.
